title: consistent predictable error messages
body:
A long build process involving lots of dependencies often fails without any obvious error message at the end.  Sometimes, reading of loooooong logs line by line is necessary to identify the error. It would be great if every error message started with something fixed, like gcc-style "Error: ...". That would allow to find error messages in build logs easily. 

### What did you do?
https://play.golang.org/p/GMT52cBqGe

### What did you expect to see?
tmp/sandbox995579036/main.go:8: Error: undefined: fmt.Printn

### What did you see instead?
tmp/sandbox995579036/main.go:8: undefined: fmt.Printn
